subject: RE: [junit] Code coverage analysis with JUnit
msgSnippet: I m not sure how you define large scale but we are using JUnit with EMMA on the commercial product under development right now.  EMMA does everything we ve
messageBody:
I'm not sure how you define "large scale" but we are
using JUnit with EMMA on the commercial product under
development right now. EMMA does everything we've
needed so far, and so I don't feel any design to change.
But there are definitely other good coverage tools out
there, too.

The cost of implementation is very low, as is the cost
of switching. So why not go with EMMA for now and if
you find it doesn't do something you need, switch it
out later?


Todd.



> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of Anderson John-QA2554
> Sent: Friday, February 10, 2006 7:20 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Code coverage analysis with JUnit
>
>
> Has anyone integrated and used JUnit and EMMA on a large
> scale commercial product? If so, were you satisfied with
> EMMA as a code coverage analysis tool?
>
> Is there a better open source code coverage analysis tool
> available that works with JUnit?
>
> Are there a better commercial code coverage analysis tools
> available that work with JUnit?
>
> Thx,
>
> John
>
>
